How to Install libmeep-dev on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • libmeep-dev

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install libmeep-dev on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing libmeep-dev on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall libmeep-dev in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install libmeep-dev, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install libmeep-dev Using apt

To install libmeep-dev in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install libmeep-dev using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install libmeep-dev

The installation of libmeep-dev might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install libmeep-dev Using apt-get

To install libmeep-dev using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install libmeep-dev.

sudo apt-get -y install libmeep-dev

Install libmeep-dev Using Synaptic

To install libmeep-dev using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install libmeep-dev on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for libmeep-dev. This will display the libmeep-dev package in the package window, now to install libmeep-dev, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the libmeep-dev package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of libmeep-dev.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install libmeep-dev Using aptitude

To install libmeep-dev on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of libmeep-dev.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install libmeep-dev using the command aptitude install libmeep-dev.

sudo aptitude -y install libmeep-dev

How to Upgrade libmeep-dev on debian

If you want to upgrade the libmeep-dev package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade libmeep-dev using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade libmeep-dev to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade libmeep-dev.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade libmeep-dev sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade libmeep-dev

Upgrade libmeep-dev using Aptitude

To upgrade libmeep-dev using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade libmeep-dev.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade libmeep-dev

Upgrade libmeep-dev using Synaptic

To upgrade libmeep-dev using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for libmeep-dev, now right-click libmeep-dev, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade libmeep-dev just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall libmeep-dev on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall libmeep-dev from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just libmeep-dev, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove libmeep-dev

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of libmeep-dev

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of libmeep-dev you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge libmeep-dev

Remove libmeep-dev using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall libmeep-dev using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for libmeep-dev, right-click the libmeep-dev package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall libmeep-dev click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install libmeep-dev on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade libmeep-dev using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of libmeep-dev then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
